citation.article-title: Transfer of Actinosporangium violaceum Krasil'nikov and Yuan, Actinosporangium vitaminophilum Shomura et al. and Actinopycnidium caeruleum Krasil'nikov to the genus Streptomyces, with amended description of the species.

p.s: Description of Streptomyces humiferus nom. nov.
Streptomyces humiferus (hu. mif'er. us. L n. humus ground; L.v. fero to bear; M.L. adj. humifems borne of the ground, ie. soil borne)
The description is based upon information taken from several sources (Krasil'nikov and Yuan, 1961; Becker et al., 1965; Williams et al., 1983).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, mesophilic organism which forms extensively branched substrate and aerial mycelium.
Spore chains are Spirales; the spore surface is smooth.
The aerial spore mass is grey; the reverse is red-orange and the pigment is pH sensitive; red-orange diffusible pigments which are also pH sensitive are produced.
Allantoin, adenine, aesculin, arbutin, elastin, gelatin, guanine, hypoxanthine, pectin, starch, testosterone, tyrosine, urea and xanthine are degraded but chitin and lecithin are not.
Hydrogen sulphide is produced and nitrate is reduced.

L-arabinose, cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, meso-inositol, D-lactose, mannitol, D-mannose, Dmelibiose, raffinose, L-rhamnose, trehalose and D-xylose are used as sole carbon sources but adontiol, inulin, Dmelezitose, sucrose and xylitol are not.

Grow on L-arginine, L-cysteine, L-histidine, L-phenylalanine, potassium nitrate, L-threonine and L-valine, but not on DL-amino-n-butyric acid, L-hydroxyproline, L-methionine or L-serine, as sole nitrogen sources.
Growth at 10 and 37°C but not at 4 or 45°C.
Tolerant to phenol (0.01%, w/v) and sodium chloride (10%, w/v) but not to sodium azide (0.01%, w/v).

Antimicrobial activity shown against Streptomyces murinus lSP 5091 but not towards Aspergillus niger LIV 131, Bacillus subtilis NCIB 3610, Candida albicans CBS 562, Escherichia coli NCIB 9132, Micrococcus luteus NCIB 196, Pseudomonas fluorescens NCIB 9046 and Saccharomyces cerevisiae CBS 1171.
The peptidoglycan contains LL-diaminopimelic acid as the major diamino acid.
The mol % G+C of the DNA of the type strain has been reported to be 70.4 (Tsyganov et aI., 1966, 1970) and 72.5 (Yamaguichi, 1967).
Type strain: ATCC 15719 (= DSM 43040 = IFO 12244 = KCC 3044 = RIA 729).
